result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip A Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.  On 09/08/2015 the Court orders the $500.00 cash bond on file be paid towards the outstanding child support obligations.

2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

1:39 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Tracy Johnson present in court via telephone.  Court questions defendant regarding child support payments.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders defendant to pay a minimum of $50 total to the agent each month and if not done the defendant is to serve one week in jail.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  This is to be done every month.  Statement by Agent Johnson.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.

records.addlTxt:
11:37 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2.  Court orders counts 3,4 & 5 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: (Count 1 & 2) EACH - SWD and places the defendant on probation for 4 years.

CONDITIONS:

court costs
pay child support and arrears
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
